meanings.definition: The quality or state of being imaginable.
meanings.sent1: The imaginablenesses of fairy tales capture the hearts of children.
meanings.sent2: Her stories are full of vivid imaginablenesses that transport readers to magical worlds.
meanings.sent3: The imaginablenesses in his mind often lead to creative and fantastical dreams.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting was a masterpiece, showcasing the endless imaginablenesses of his imagination.
meanings.sent5: The book painted a picture of unimaginable beauty, filled with endless imaginablenesses.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be imagined or conceived.
meanings.sent1: The vast imaginablenesses of the universe are beyond our comprehension.
meanings.sent2: His mind was filled with endless imaginablenesses, each more fantastical than the last.
meanings.sent3: The imaginablenesses of what could go wrong kept him up at night.
meanings.sent4: The possibilities were as vast as the ocean, stretching out into endless imaginablenesses.
meanings.sent5: Her imagination knew no bounds, exploring the vast imaginablenesses of the unknown.
